alert.note: Alert for West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 22 at 1:23PM PST until February 22 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...Moderate to locally heavy snow in the Sierra through this evening with low snow levels... .A cold weather system will continue bring moderate to locally heavy snow to the northern Sierra Nevada through this evening. Low snow levels may bring a dusting of snow into the lower foothill elevations during this time. Prepare for difficult travel conditions. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow occurring. Plan on difficult travel conditions, including during the evening commute. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches are expected, locally higher over peaks. * WHERE...West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada including Interstate 80 over Donner Pass, Highway 50 over Echo Summit and Highway 88 over Carson Pass. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 10 PM today. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Be prepared for significant reductions in visibility at times. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Storm Warning for snow means there will be snow covered roads and limited visibilities. Travel is not recommended while the warning is in effect. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
